turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Listen, Willie. Do exactly what I tell you now.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Okay, I want you to lift your hand -- and pet the snake.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Yes, stroke it right along the maxillary and precaudal vertebrae.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Pet it on the head! Go on, pet it!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Oh -- my -- god -- it's going to crush me!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Thanks for nothing! I hate snakes!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Where'd you find your little bodyguard?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I met Short Round when he tried to pick my pocket.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Shorty's family was killed when they bombed Shanghai. He was living on the streets.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: He'll be okay. He's a good kid.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: By the way, how'd you end up in Shanghai?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Well, when my nightclub career was run over by the Depression, some pinhead convinced me that "a girl could go places in the Orient..." So, look where I got.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Oh, that's easy -- I'm going to latch onto a good-looking, incredibly rich prince.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I'd like to find one of those myself.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Yeah, but he's got to be dead and buried for a couple of thousand years.  Fortune and glory...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Is that what you're hoping to find at this palace, Dr. Jones?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: The drawing shows a priest named Sankara who lived centuries ago.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's Sanskrit. It tells the story of Sankara climbing Mt. Kalisa where he met the Hindu god Shiva.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: That's Shiva? What's he giving the Priest?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Legend says he told Sankara to go forth and combat evil. To do that he gave him five sacred stones that had magical powers.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You mean magical like the rock that was stolen from that village?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I think you should sleep closer.  I meant for safety.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I'd be safer sleeping with that snake.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: He said he couldn't take us any farther. He has to go sell the elephants.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You mean we have to walk the rest of the way?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Yeah, I wish you'd thought of this sooner...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I've always had a weakness for folk dancing.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: She might get away with that act here, but she'd never make it in a real nightclub.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Cheer up, you lost your prince, but dinner's on the way.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I've never been so hungry in my life...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You're nice. Listen, I'm taking applications -- how'd you like to be my palace slave?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Wearing your jewels to bed, princess?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Yeah -- and nothing else.  That shock you?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I'm a scientist. I like doing research on certain "nocturnal activities" --

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You're talking to an authority in that area.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You're dying to come into my room, aren't you?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You want me so bad, why don't you invite me?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Too proud to admit you're crazy about me, Dr. Jones?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I think you're too used to getting you own way, Willie...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: We'll see who gives in first -- I'll leave my door open.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Five minutes... you'll be back over here in five minutes...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You're dreaming, Willie. You want to make it real, just knock on my door.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Gee, I wouldn't want to touch an ugly critter like that!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You know, Willie, I'll bet he's mad because they were eating his friends for dinner.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Please -- oh please, I'm going to die! Get it off!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Willie, come here! Hurry up, we're in trouble!!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I'm coming, what's the rush?! Ohh! What's that?! There's stuff all over the floor! I can't see a thing!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: There's bugs! Bugs all over! Help! Help me!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Willie, open the door! GET US OUT OF HERE!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: GET US OUT! Willie, shut up and listen! There's got to be a fulcrum release! Look around!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I can't find any lever! Help me Indy!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: There's a hole! I found a square hole!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: That's it -- the release lever -- look inside!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Oh God, it's soft -- it's moving!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's a Thuggee ceremony. They're worshipping Kali, the goddess of Death and Destruction.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Oh my God! He ripped out his -- he killed him!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Let's go! Let's get out of here!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Down? Down there?! Are you crazy!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I'm not leaving without those stones.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You're gonna get killed chasing after your damn fortune and glory!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's okay. You're all right now.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: They think I'm insane. Tell them I'm not, Indy. Please -- help me ...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You've got to go to sleep now.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I don't blame you... this hasn't been what you'd call a fun vacation...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Indy? Did you talk to them?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I was scared to death last night when I thought they were going to kill you.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You know you've been nothing but trouble since I hooked up with you -- but I have to admit I'd miss you if I lost you...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: There's got to be another way out.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Let her go! Our only chance is outrunning them!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Yeah -- this time you're gonna help!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I guess Mola Ram got what he wanted.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: And they don't even know what it really is.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Well, you didn't get your prince, and there goes your diamond.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You didn't do so well yourself. Finding that stone could've gotten you all the fortune and glory you were talking about.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's still a long way to Delhi. Who knows what might happen.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: This is the first time anybody ever cried when I left.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: They don't cry about you. They cry about the elephants leaving.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: They got no food to feed them. So they taking the elephants away to sell them.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I'm going to puke in it...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I don't appreciate being cooked like a french fry!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm reporting you to the .....transit authority!!!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No...no...it's nothing.. Rehearsing a play...  What light through yonder window breaks...It is Al... and he's in my head.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're in my head? You don't know my name?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What??? You lose your lease on a condo?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Where are we? We're on the street. We're walking down the street. We're talking to ourselves. People are staring at us.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What street?! We're walking down QUEER STREET. We coming to Dopey Drive. We're about to be put somewhere quiet where they won't mind that we talk to ourselves.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Go home. Good idea. Get some rest.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: ...I need to make a phone call.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're in my head, you can talk to me and hear what I say, but you can't see anything.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Kind of an oversight, wouldn't you say.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'm working on it. Soon as I find the right nerve bundle.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Nerve bundle! What are you doing? You just leave the nerve bundles right where they are.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well...If you're in my head... to you, I'm...GOD!

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Quit screwing around, this is important.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It's my head, I'll be the judge of that. Anyway, who are you?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I told you, my name is Al.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What are you doing in my head, Al?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'm trying to get you to listen to reason.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Look! I didn't ask to be in you. Don't blame me for it. You did it.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Yeah. What did you do? You explain it. ...why I'm not at the lab right now, in my tube, with my crew. Explain that!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: The Nicholson Node. I suppose you haven't heard of that either.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I just went there for a job.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Don't do it.  Don't aim at the head.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Used to be, things were bad. No job...no money...no girl. Now I got all that and I'm crazy too.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You're not crazy. Don't...wait a minute, just let me explain.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Yeah JOE Why there's a little man in my head?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Yes...Yes...I'll explain it all. Just put the gun down.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: With a man in my head...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Who was that? Somebody out there?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Sorry...all this...buzzing in my head.  Why don't I just take you back to UST?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'll tell you what to say.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: If I get you back to the lab, will you get out of my head?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: If I'm real, they'll get me out. If I'm not, they'll treat you. Either way you'll be better off than you are now. You'll get a reward.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No one. Maybe I dreamed it all up.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Nothing. Just the cyclist. He's passed us.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: He's not the problem. It's the van in the back.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Then what are you stopping for?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Get your breathing down. You sound like a cement mixer.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Why? AL  You know too much.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't know anything. I just want to go home.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You have no choice, you're involved. Will you help?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: How do you act when someone trys to kill you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah.  Al wants to talk to you!

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I don't know. I don't want to find out.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: They could put you back in the tube..

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'd be helpless and useless. They don't have the PEM. Without that...there's no chance.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well...they sure as hell aren't gonna get it for you.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: They're busy covering their asses. They're not the type of people we need."

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You're the one talking to a little guy in your head.  ...We'll have to do it on our own.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I did. I brought you back here.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Think of the scientific data we'll gain. Come on, lets get out of here.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm not leaving until you do.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Ever think of what they might have to do to find me?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'm not gonna make it easy.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: They'll have to take you apart. ...piece by piece.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Why don't you just get out, leave me alone.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't like the sound of that.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: We have to get out of here.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: See the codelock? Punch this in. 26993

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Go out, take your first left.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Take a left and your next right.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Is it familiar? Have you been here before.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I was thirsty. He told me to get a drink.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Oh my God...What did he look like, the man?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Like the guys that attacked us.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: That's it. They know I'm in here. We've got to find them.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: They think we're safe here. They don't really need us. They're probably long gone.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You do. To get out of here. You're gonna be me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't wanna be you. I wanna go home.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You can't go home. When UST finds we're gone, they'll come after you and put us away.
